panels.description: If TEQs are running or not
panels.title: TEQ Status

panels.description: Aggregate enq/deq rates for all TEQs
panels.title: Overall Enqueue/Dequeue Rate

panels.description: Total enqueued messages for the entire queue system
panels.title: Overall Enqueue Messages

panels.description: Total dequeued messages for the entire queue system
panels.title: Overall Dequeue Messages

panels.description: The number of TEQs running
panels.title: Total TEQ

panels.description: Approximate aggregate bytes-in/bytes-out rates for all TEQs
panels.title: Overall Bytes In/Bytes Out Rate

panels.description: The total number of subscribers for all TEQs
panels.title: Total TEQ Subscriber

panels.description: TEQ Quick Lookup Table: simply click on the metric name and order it increasingly or decreasingly, easy to identify a 'good' queue or a 'bad' queue.
panels.title: TEQ Quick Lookup Table

panels.description: If Oracle DB is running or not.
panels.title: Oracle DB Status

panels.description: The number of active user sessions
panels.title: Active User Sessions

panels.description: The number of active background sessions
panels.title: Active Background Sessions

panels.description: The number of inactive user sessions
panels.title: Inactive User Sessions

panels.description: The number of Oracle processes running
panels.title: Number of Processes

panels.description: Oracle Automatic Storage Management disk group memory usage (e.g. +DATA, +RECO)
panels.title: ASM Disk Usage

panels.description: The number of DB activity occurred including execute count, user commits, parse count total, user rollbacks
panels.title: DB Activity

panels.description: Average latency for DB wait class in ms including administrative, application, commit, concurrency, configuration, idle, network, other, system I/O, user I/O
panels.title: DB Wait Class Latency

panels.description: The number of CPU of the system running Oracle DB.
panels.title: Number of CPUs

panels.description: Current number of processes that are either running or in the ready state, waiting to be selected by the operating-system scheduler to run. On many platforms, this statistic reflects the average load over the past minute.
panels.title: OS CPU Load

panels.description: The CPU usage in percentage in real time including CPU in busy state or CPU in executing user code.
panels.title: CPU Usage (Busy + User)

panels.description: Total physical memory of the system.
panels.title: Total Physical Memory

panels.description: Total free physical memory of the system.
panels.title: Total Free Physical Memory

panels.description: The percentage of free memory in the system.
panels.title: System Physical Free Memory

panels.description: Total messages enqueued/dequeued to/from the TEQ.
panels.title: Enqueue/Dequeue Messages

panels.description: Enq/deq rate for the TEQ.
panels.title: Enqueue/Dequeue Rate

panels.description: The name of TEQ.
panels.title: TEQ Name

panels.description: The name of TEQ subscriber.
panels.title: Subscriber Name

panels.description: Total amount of time to consume all messages if there is no enq.
panels.title: Time to Drain if No Enq

panels.description: Time difference between current time and the time since the last deq operation.
panels.title: Time since Last Deq

panels.description: Average message latency for last 5 mins. Will be available in DB 21C, stay tuned!
panels.title: TEQ Message Latency for 5 Mins

panels.description: Average message latency for last 1 hour. Will be available in DB 21C, stay tuned!
panels.title: TEQ Message Latency for 1 Hour

panels.description: Average message latency for last 5 hours. Will be available in DB 21C, stay tuned!
panels.title: TEQ Message Latency for 5 Hours

panels.description: Total messages remained in the queue.
panels.title: TEQ Depth (Remaining Messages)
